mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'Don't count your chickens before the eggs have hatched' mean?

options.a: Do not plan the outcome of an event until it has occurred
options.b: Do not make plans based on future events that may not happen
options.c: Counting the number of chickens you have

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'Don't count your chickens before the eggs have hatched' advises against planning based on assumptions, as things may not turn out as expected.
